definition[0]: if a liquid sloshes somewhere, or if you slosh it, it moves or is moved about in an uncontrolled way
example[0]: He put the glass down hard and beer sloshed over the edge.
example[1]: Water was sloshing about in the bottom of the boat.
definition[1]: to put a liquid in a container or on a surface in a careless way
example[2]: Jo sloshed more wine into her glass.
example[3]: Slosh a bit of paint on.
definition[2]: to walk through water or mud in a noisy way
example[4]: People were sloshing around in the mud.
